sentences.en: Divorce? It was such a forbidden word.
sentences.cn: 离婚？这个词可不能轻易说出口。

sentences.en: He has expressly forbidden her to go out on her own.
sentences.cn: 他已经明确禁止她独自外出。

sentences.en: It is strictly forbidden to obtain confessions and to give them credence.
Jockeys are forbidden to bet on the outcome of races.
sentences.cn: 职业赛马骑师禁止对赛马结果下注。

sentences.en: Men fantasise as a substitute for acting out forbidden desires.
sentences.cn: 人类通过幻想宣泄压抑的欲望。

sentences.en: Photography is strictly forbidden in the museum.
Prostitutes were forbidden to solicit on public roads and in public places.
sentences.cn: 禁止妓女在马路上和公共场所公然拉客。

sentences.en: Sex was always a forbidden topic.
sentences.cn: 性在过去一直是个禁忌话题。

sentences.en: She was expressly forbidden to touch my papers.
sentences.cn: 已经明确禁止她动我的文件。

sentences.en: Smoking is forbidden here. Please put your cigarette out.
sentences.cn: 这里禁止吸烟, 请将您的烟熄灭.

sentences.en: The staff are forbidden to tender for private-sector work.
sentences.cn: 工作人员不得投标承接私营部门的工作。

sentences.en: The war was a forbidden subject.
sentences.cn: 战争曾经是人们避讳的话题。

sentences.en: This was a forbidden area for foreigners.
sentences.cn: 这里曾经禁止外国人进入。

sentences.en: We were forbidden, under pain of imprisonment, to use our native language.
sentences.cn: 我们被禁止使用母语，违者将被关进监狱。

words.tran_cn: 令人生畏的；严峻的；险恶的
被禁止的；严禁的，[计]禁用的

trans.tran_cn: 不允许的，被禁止的，禁用的
trans.tran_en: not allowed, especially because of an official rule
